Research Papers People News Contact

  • Hajra Basit

    Nov. 1st, 2018

    Hajra joined the Wallace group in Oxford on a Marie Curie IE fellowship in July 2014. In her time in the Wallace group, she studied the twin-arginine transport system, both, in vivo and in vitro. She then obtained a John Fell fund in collaboration with Simon Newstead, to extend this work to studying other transporter proteins of the MFS type in artificial bilayers, using single-molecule FRET.

  • Christopher Parperis

    Oct. 12th, 2018

    Christopher joined the Wallace group in 2017. Working in collaboration with Oxford Nanopore Technologies his PhD research looks to examine the mechanism of DNA sensing in a protein nanopore.

  • New paper - Urea-Mediated Anomalous Diffusion in Supported Lipid Bilayers

    Sept. 27th, 2018

    E. E. Weatherill, H. L. E. Coker, M. R. Cheetham, M. I. Wallace ArXiv 2018

  • New paper - Lipid Bilayer Modulation using DNA Origami Mimics of Clathrin.

    Sept. 27th, 2018

    V. Ramakrishna, C. Journot, A. J. Turberfield, M. I. Wallace Biophysical Journal 2018

  • New paper - Dynamic tuneable G protein-coupled receptor monomer-dimer populations.

    Sept. 27th, 2018

    Patricia M. Dijkman, Oliver K. Castell, Alan D. Goddard, Juan C. Munoz-Garcia, Chris de Graaf, Mark I. Wallace & Anthony Watts Nature Communications 2018
